episodes.title: Why dark pools became a bad dream for European banks
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: Regulators are going after the private exchange operations of European banks.

episodes.title: Explaining the stock split: Some financial gymnastics
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: In the end, stock splits are all about making shares more appealing to investors.

episodes.title: The difference between debt and deficit: An explainer
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: A lot of people confuse the words debt and deficit. They're not quite the same.

episodes.title: What the heck does ETF stand for? An explainer
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: Why investing in ETFs can be like playing with fire.

episodes.title: Explainer: Why dollar cost averaging is stupid smart
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: When it comes to investing: keep it simple, stupid.

episodes.title: Drowning in debt? Consider a restructuring
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: Restructuring sounds scary because it's often associated with bankruptcy.

episodes.title: When a company gives 'guidance': An explainer
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: Google's profit dropped 11 percent and the company's stock jumped. How does that work?

episodes.title: What is an index fund?: An explainer
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: An index is quite simply a basket of shares.

episodes.title: How feeling rich helps the economy: An explainer
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: When we feel wealthy, we spend more. It’s called the wealth effect.

episodes.title: When going short goes badly wrong
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: This is a Marketplace.org Reader

episodes.title: The magic of compounding: An explainer
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: Compounding is one of the best tools out there to build wealth.

episodes.title: How borrowing money can create wealth: Explainer
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: There are a million get-rich schemes out there, but here's one of the oldest: borrowing.

episodes.title: Explainer: Why can't we cap CEO pay?
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: Switzerland recently toyed with the idea of capping CEO pay at 12 times the amount of the lowest-paid worker.

episodes.title: Explainer: the charitable tax deduction
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: If you give $1,000 to charity, that reduces your taxable income by $1,000, because there’s less for the government to tax.

episodes.title: Explainer: Fiscal hawks vs. fiscal doves
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: Why are those who want to fight inflation called 'fiscal hawks'?

episodes.title: Explaining capital adequacy requirements
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: Changes to capital adequacy requirements are a cornerstone of the government’s  efforts to secure the financial system. Marketplace’s Paddy Hirsch explains.

episodes.title: Obama & the debt ceiling: An explainer
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: The government is considering raising the debt ceiling -- again. But what exactly is the debt ceiling: Watch an explainer to understand what's at stake and what it means for you and me.

episodes.title: Explaining exchanges
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: You've heard of the New York Stock Exchange and Nasdaq. Do people really still stand around and yell out buy and sell orders at these places? Paddy Hirsch explains what an exchange is -- by taking us to the supermarket.

episodes.title: So what is LIBOR, exactly?
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: The London Interbank Offered Rate, explained.

episodes.title: Opportunity cost: A simple Whiteboard explainer
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: Economists love to use the term "opportunity cost." In fact, you've probably heard it before. But what is it exactly? Senior producer and Whiteboard expert Paddy Hirsch explains.

episodes.title: Fiat money: It has nothing to do with the car
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: Your dollar bill isn't worth the paper it's printed on. Why? Because it's a fiat currency. Sr. Producer Paddy Hirsch explains.

episodes.title: How a firm's goodwill is more like soft snow than a hard asset
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: Goodwill reads like an afterthought in a company's annual report. But it's often the most important component of a company's operation, as Sr. Producer Paddy Hirsch explains.

episodes.title: Why a currency war could hurt you
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: A currency war sounds weirdly abstract, like a game played by rival politicians -- but it can have devastating effects in the real world. And it’s not all that different from a rivalry of different kind – a hypothetical sibling rivalry.

episodes.title: Explaining the FHA with help from Uncle Charlie
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: What is the Federal Housing Administration and how does it work? Uncle Charlie and Sr. Producer Paddy Hirsch explain.

episodes.title: Shadow Banking - still dangerous
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: This is a Marketplace.org Reader

episodes.title: Explaining dividend recapitalization
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: Dividend recapitalization: private equity shenanigans or sound common sense? Sr. Producer Paddy Hirsch explains how it works.

episodes.title: The fiscal cliff explained (with help from Hollywood)
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: You've heard warnings about the economic disaster that could happen if Congress fails to avoid a fiscal cliff. But what is the fiscal cliff anyway? Sr. Producer Paddy Hirsch enlists the support of his friends Thelma and Louise in this three-minute...

episodes.title: The economic effects of quantitative easing
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: Marketplace's Paddy Hirsch explains what QE3 is supposed to do for the economy.

episodes.title: VIDEO: The ECB's bond-buying program explained with bonbons
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: The European Central Bank is set to go on a bond-buying spree in an effort to save the euro and stem the debt crisis. But how does it work? It helps to think about candy.

episodes.title: Explaining what blind trust is with sausages
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: Presidential hopeful Mitt Romney says he put his investments in a blind trust to avoid any conflict of interest. So what exactly is a blind trust? Sr. Producer Paddy Hirsch explains with a sausage factory analogy.

episodes.title: What's a floating-rate note and how does it work?
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: The Treasury Department is planning to roll out a floating-rate note program in about a year. But what is a floating-rate note and why do we need one? Sr. Producer Paddy Hirsch explains with a boat analogy.

episodes.title: Eurobond: An explainer
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: What exactly is a Eurobond and why are so many people interested in having them? Sr. Producer Paddy Hirsch explains with a little help from the three little pigs.

episodes.title: Explaining the Fed's 'Operation Twist'  with diamonds
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: The Federal Reserve's most recent policy move is simply a way of driving down interest rates. But how does it work? Sr. Producer Paddy Hirsch explains Operation Twist with a simple analogy.

episodes.title: Why a bank run is bad
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: A bank run occurs when customers run down to the bank and demand their money back. So, why can't the bank just return the cash? Sr. Producer Paddy Hirsch explains using a human heart analogy.

episodes.title: What's an index of credit default swaps?
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: Big bets on an obscure index lay at the heart of JPMorgan's losses this week. Sr. Producer Paddy Hirsch explains how an index of CDS works.

episodes.title: Assets: What are they anyway?
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: Surely you've heard the term assets -- they can be toxic, liquid, or tangible. Sr. Producer Paddy Hirsch explains what the word “assets” really means.

episodes.title: FDIC spells a good, sound sleep for savers
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: Seventeen banks have failed so far this year, but their customers can rest easy -- thanks to the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation, as Sr. Producer Paddy Hirsch explains.

episodes.title: The role of a fiduciary
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: Sr. Producer Paddy Hirsch explains the responsibilities of a fiduciary with a taxi metaphor.

episodes.title: Explaining insider trading
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: Lawmakers are considering yet another bill to ban insider trading. But the term "insider trading" seems open to interpretation. Senior Producer Paddy Hirsch helps us understand what it is and why it's a big deal.

episodes.title: Explaining proprietary trading and its risks
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: Prop trading, as it’s called on Wall Street, is the target of the Volcker Rule, a centerpiece of the Dodd-Frank financial reform act. Marketplace’s Paddy Hirsch explains what proprietary trading is, and why it’s potentially dangerous for our savings...

episodes.title: What’s an IPO?
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: So Facebook has filed to go public. How exactly does an initial public offering work? Marketplace's Paddy Hirsch explains.

episodes.title: What's the difference: Secured vs. unsecured bonds
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: Learn the difference between secured and unsecured debt -- a lesson that Irish taxpayers could use as they face the prospect of footing the bill for the bailout of state-owned Anglo Irish Bank.

episodes.title: Private equity explained
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: Private equity funds are groups of investors that flip companies for a profit. It’s the technique they use that makes them special, as senior producer Paddy Hirsch explains.

episodes.title: Re-hypothecation: How it's related to MF Global
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: If ever there was a word that you’d expect to find in a Harry Potter novel, it’s re-hypothecation. But it's not just a magic trick.

episodes.title: What is a junk bond?
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: Junk. Not a nice word. And when it comes to bonds, not a particularly accurate word, either. Junk is something useless, right? Well, "junk" bonds are definitely not useless. In fact they're extremely useful. Sometimes. Marketplace Senior...

episodes.title: Why does the EU want U.S. dollars?
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: Marketplace Money Senior Producer Paddy Hirsch explains why Europe needs dollars instead of euros as the EU tries to sort out its financial problems.

episodes.title: Ring-fencing Italy
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: There's been a lot of talk recently about the need to ring-fence certain economies in Europe. These aren't the economies that have defaulted or been bailed out; these are the economies that are too big to fail. Italy is the most glaring example.

episodes.title: The root of Italy's problems
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: Berlusconi may be gone, but Italia's problems persists. Senior Editor Paddy Hirsch explains how Italy got into the mess it's in today.

episodes.title: Haircut: More dangerous than it sounds
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: If Greece accepts the terms of a new aid package it's expected to get a haircut on its debt. But Sr. Editor Paddy Hirsch explain why that haircut...

episodes.title: WHITEBOARD: Exposure -- not necessarily a bad thing
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: Most people have dark thoughts when they hear the word exposure, but exposure can be beneficial -- if it's done in moderation, as I explain in this...

episodes.title: WHITEBOARD: What do companies do with all that cash?
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: Companies are hoarding cash -- to cushion themselves if the economy worsens. But where do they keep all that money? Senior Editor Paddy Hirsch explains

episodes.title: WHITEBOARD: What is a yield curve?
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: If you've been following what the Federal Reserve is doing with the interest rate of late, you have probably heard them talk about the yield curve...

episodes.title: WHITEBOARD: Fiscal policy vs. monetary policy
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: Often conflated, often confused, fiscal and monetary policies take very different approaches to influence the economy. And they rely on two very ...

episodes.title: WHITEBOARD: The name's Bond. Eurobond.
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: James Bond is a weapon of last resort, the man you send in when diplomacy and threats have failed. Eurobond is a similar sort of chap......

episodes.title: WHITEBOARD: What is a ratings agency, anyway?
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary:
How credit agencies work from Marketplace on Vimeo.



Here's how I look at it. Imagine a house, full of medical students, none of whom have a ...

episodes.title: Why the debt ceiling debate is affecting the economy
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: If the U.S. economy were an airport, the debt-ceiling debate on Capitol Hill is like a dark cloud causing flight delays, says Senior Editor Paddy Hirsch in his latest Whiteboard video

episodes.title: Meet the Maes: Whiteboard explores the Mae family tree
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary:
Paddy Hirsch returns to the Whiteboard to explain the history of the Mae Family Tree.

The fate of Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac, the government-spo...

episodes.title: Spotting a double-dip recession
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: While fears of a double-dip recession have receded in the U.S. for now, there's still some talk about a double-dip recession striking other markets around the world. Paddy Hirsch explains what a double dip is, and what it might look like.

episodes.title: Why the Fed is buying back Treasuries and how that helps
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: Here's an email I got earllier this week:...

episodes.title: Beware the carry trade!
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: With interest rates in the U.S. at historic lows, some economists are worried that Americans involved in the carry trade could drive down the value of the dollar. Senior Editor Paddy Hirsch explains how the carry trade works, and why some people are...

episodes.title: Bankers go head to head over Tier 1 capital
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: Tier 1 capital is the money that's at the core of every bank. But, like everything else in banking, it's subject to definition, and bankers still can't agree on the terms. Senior Editor Paddy Hirsch explains.

episodes.title: Market makers, stub quotes and new SEC rules
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: The Securities and Exchange Commission wants to make equity markets safer by pushing market makers to tighten up their standards, and stop making so-called stub quotes. Paddy Hirsch explains.

episodes.title: Currency pegs
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: Pressure from the US may have pushed China to unpeg its currency from the dollar this week. But how did that peg work in the first place? Paddy Hirsch explains.

episodes.title: 'Casino' banks targeted in Volcker Rule
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: The Volcker rule is a cornerstone of the Dodd-Frank financial overhaul. But what is it? Paddy Hirsch explains in this video from 2010.

episodes.title: Whiteboard: Investors sue banks over fiduciary responsibility
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: Investor lawsuits over failed bank investments are becoming more commonplace. As Senior Editor Paddy Hirsch explains in the latest from his Whiteboard series, it all comes down to a little thing called fiduciary.

episodes.title: Whiteboard: Counterparty risk
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: Europe is teetering on the edge of a credit crisis, and markets all around the world are tumbling as investors worry about contagion. It's all about banks not trusting each other, as Senior Editor Paddy Hirsch explains.

episodes.title: Fannie, Freddie and the Fed
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: The Federal Reserve said this week it will no longer buy mortgage backed securities from Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac. Some people worry mortgage rates could rise as a result. Senior Editor Paddy Hirsch explains why.

episodes.title: Cov-lite loans are back
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: Lyondell Chemical issued the fist covenant-lite loan since the financial crisis subsided. Senior editor Paddy Hirsch explains what a cov-lite loan is, and why their return could be bad for the economy

episodes.title: CLOs
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: Collateralized loan obligations are back! Paddy Hirsch explains what CLOs are, and why they're important.

episodes.title: Repo 105
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: It's the title of a dubious financing transaction that Lehman Brothers used in 2008 to make its balance sheet look healthier than it really was. Senior Editor Paddy Hirsch takes a stab at explaining how Repo 105 worked.

episodes.title: Subprime: A meaty explanation
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: The Federal Housing Administration is being criticized for underwriting subprime loans, which critics say could lead to another wave of loan failures. Senior Editor Paddy Hirsch explains subprime lending and its inherent risks.

episodes.title: PIIGS
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: Five little PIIGS. Senior Editor Paddy Hirsch explains why problems with certain European countries' sovereign debt could blow the house down.

episodes.title: How the big banks make the big bucks
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: We keep hearing the banks aren't lending. The truth is they are lending, and making a lot of money doing it, thanks in large part to one very special borrower. Senior Editor Paddy Hirsch reports.

episodes.title: Ratings conflict
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: Ratings agencies are paid by the sellers of the securities they rate. Critics say there's a conflict of interest there. Senior Editor Paddy Hirsch explains.

episodes.title: Interest rates
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: Confused about the theory of how interest rates can affect economic growth? Senior Editor Paddy Hirsch is here with a handy analogy.

episodes.title: Hostile takeovers
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: We all know what a takeover is. That's when one company agrees to be bought by another. But what happens when companies don't agree and the takeover goes hostile? Senior Editor Paddy Hirsch explains.

episodes.title: Derivatives: An explanation
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: Credit default swaps? They're complicated -- and scary! The receipt you get when you pre-order your Thanksgiving turkey? Not so much. But they have a lot in common: They're both derivatives. Senior Editor Paddy Hirsch explains.

episodes.title: Bonds, notes and bills
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: So much government debt! But what's the difference between the Treasury's bills, notes and bonds? Senior Editor Paddy Hirsch explains.

episodes.title: Inflation
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: Most economists agree that inflation of about 2% or 3% annually is a natural function of a growing economy. But people are worried government stimulus measures could spark much higher inflation. Senior Editor Paddy Hirsch explains

episodes.title: Explaining high-frequency trading
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: High-frequency trading is creating a ruckus on Wall Street. Marketplace Senior Editor Paddy Hirsch explains what high-frequency trading is and why some people are up in arms about it.

episodes.title: Factoring
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: Many small businesses get the cash they need to operate and expand from so-called factors. One of the biggest factors in the business is CIT, and with CIT on the ropes, small businesses are worried. Senior Editor Paddy Hirsch explains what factoring is...

episodes.title: Financial alchemy
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: Many asset-backed securities have been downgraded from AAA recently. But at least one issuer has miraculously repackaged a downgraded deal to make some of its bonds worth a AAA rating again. Senior Editor Paddy Hirsch explains.

episodes.title: Where's the toxic waste?
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: Banks are paying back TARP money and claiming they're the picture of health. So what happened to all those toxic assets that were clogging their arteries a few months back? Senior Editor Paddy Hirsch explains.

episodes.title: Dark pools: An explainer
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: Dark pools are exchanges where people trade stocks anonymously. Senior Editor Paddy Hirsch explains how they work, and why the SEC is considering regulating them.

episodes.title: The 'repo' market
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: It's a vital part of the financial system, and the government is considering changes to it.

episodes.title: Meet Cap 'n Trade
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: Cap and Trade is the linchpin of the government's effort to curb carbon emissions. Senior Editor Paddy Hirsch explains how the cap and trade model works.

episodes.title: Capital structure
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: In stories about the auto companies and the banks, we've been hearing about debt-to-equity swaps and exchanging preferred shares for common stock. To understand how those work, you need to understand a company's capital structure. Senior...

episodes.title: Shadow banking: The primer
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: The shadow banking system is a key component of the U.S. economy, but the financial crisis has frozen it solid. Senior Editor Paddy Hirsch explains what shadow banking is and why it's important enough to warrant its own bailout, called the Term...

episodes.title: The public-private partnership
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: The U.S. Treasury Department plans to recruit private investors to take toxic assets off banks' balance sheets. Senior Editor Paddy Hirsch explains how the plan is supposed to work.

episodes.title: Collateral calls
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: Millions of Americans are wondering why AIG has paid so much taxpayer money to other banks. One reason is because AIG has had to honor "collateral calls" -- demands made by banks on the insurance contracts it's written. Senior Editor...

episodes.title: The Uptick Rule
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: Bankers have been debating bringing back the uptick rule for months, if not years. This week the debate made it to Capitol Hill. Senior Editor Paddy Hirsch gives a quick and dirty explanation of what the uptick rule is, and why it could be reinstated...

episodes.title: Tangible Common Equity, or TCE
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: Tangible Common Equity used to be an obscure and rarely-used accounting term. Today it's one of the main motivators behind the government's decision to turn the American taxpayer into one of Citigroup's biggest stockholders. Senior...

episodes.title: Cramdowns
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: A debate is raging in Washington, D.C., about how to deal with America's foreclosure problem. One proposal is to restructure the loans using a tool usually seen in bankruptcy courts: The "cramdown." Senior Editor Paddy Hirsch explains.

episodes.title: Write-downs
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: As markets have deteriorated, "write-downs" have figured prominently in more and more corporate reports. What are write-downs all about? Marketplace Senior Editor Paddy Hirsch explains.

episodes.title: Mark to market
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: There's a debate in financial circles over whether banks are unfairly penalized by the requirement that they "mark to market" their holdings. Marketplace Senior Editor Paddy Hirsch explains what that term means.

episodes.title: Toxic assets
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: If you've been following the problems encountered by the banks, you've probably come across the phrase "toxic assets." They've poisoned banks' balance sheets and brought them to the brink of failure. But what is a toxic...

episodes.title: Why 'bad banks' might be a good thing
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: Marketplace Senior Editor Paddy Hirsch explains Fed Chairman Ben Bernanke's latest plan to get the economy moving -- and the risk involved.

episodes.title: Getting naked in short selling
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: The practice of short selling has been blamed for the collapse of several major companies' shares during the financial crisis. What is short selling? Marketplace Senior Editor Paddy Hirsch explains.

episodes.title: Quantitative easing
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: Now the Federal Reserve has effectively cut the target lending rate to zero, it only has one more weapon in its arsenal. Quantitative easing. Senior Editor Paddy Hirsch explains what this "nuclear option" it is, and what the Fed hopes it&#039...

episodes.title: A look inside hedge funds
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: Hedge funds used to occupy a dark, undisturbed corner of the financial world, but over the last year they've been thrown under the spotlight. Still, many people don't know exactly what hedge funds are, or what hedging actually means. Senior...

episodes.title: Leveraging and deleveraging
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: Leveraging -- or borrowing -- has been cited as one of the contributors to the financial crisis. Senior Editor Paddy Hirsch explains how the move to deleverage -- or reduce debt -- is prompting wild market swings and concerns about deflation

episodes.title: Why 'Fallout' for the financial crisis?
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: The meltdown of the credit and mortage markets will inflict damaging effects upon our economic future that we may not anticipate -- much like the fallout from a nuclear explosion. Senior Editor Paddy Hirsch explains why Marketplace is using the term in...

episodes.title: How credit cards become asset-backed bonds
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: Mortgages aren't the only financial instruments that get turned into securities. Marketplace Senior Editor Paddy Hirsch explains how companies make money by buying credit card debt and bundling it.

episodes.title: Margin calls and the financial market's decline
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: Some of the rapid drops we've seen in the financial markets in recent weeks have been fueled by margin calls. How do margin calls work? Marketplace Senior Editor Paddy Hirsch explains.

episodes.title: Over-the-counter, over the top
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: Credit default swaps have worsened market anxiety because they are conducted in the over-the-counter market, where regulations are few and information about risk is often hidden. Marketplace Senior Editor Paddy Hirsch explains.

episodes.title: The credit crisis as Antarctic expedition
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: Marketplace Senior Editor Paddy Hirsch explains how banks have gotten frozen in their tracks, awaiting a rescue.

episodes.title: Untangling credit default swaps
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: When the analysts and experts talk about the current financial crisis, they often refer to "credit default swaps." So, what exactly is a credit default swap? Marketplace Senior Editor Paddy Hirsch goes to the whiteboard for this explanation.

episodes.title: Crisis explainer: Uncorking CDOs
episodes.author: American Public Media
episodes.summary: Marketplace Senior Editor Paddy Hirsch gives a bubbly explanation of the intricacies of "collateralized debt obligations" -- those financial instruments that got us into this financial mess.
